title: Girlfriend met the woman her partner was cheating on her with
text:
"She was an absolutely sweet person, gorgeous face and body. We only live two blocks apart."

Cheating can be hurtful and confusing. But it's rarely just about sex.

It hit in the early hours of the morning, a compulsive itch that crawled relentlessly under the skin.

Any attempts at distraction were futile, a temporary sidetrack that did little to quell the neverending curiosity. Instead,*Ruby realised - it was better to give in straight away.

So the American woman allowed the other woman's profile to appear on the screen like a hallucination as she was frantically seeking out those messages and photos which sent sharp needles stabbing into her heart.

Despite the pain, the 33-year-old found it easier to know exactly who she was dealing with, as she shared on Reddit.

But soon Ruby hit the limit of what social media could reveal to her - so she did the unthinkable and asked to meet the woman her boyfriend had been cheating on her with.

At the time, Ruby had no idea that this meeting would end up changing her life.

Ruby decided she wanted to meet Mary in-person. Source: iStock.

"I loved that girl"

It felt completely surreal to walk into her local cafe and come face-to-face with *Mary.

For weeks, Ruby had wondered why her lawyer boyfriend would risk a stable, happy relationship for some woman who worked in a restaurant.

But as soon as she sat down at the table across from Mary, it all made sense.

“She was an absolutely sweet person, gorgeous face and body,” Ruby said.

“We only live two blocks apart. She moved to America by herself and started her life from zero, went to school, got a degree and is now opening her own business.

“She was so powerful, the way she talked about her, me, other women. I loved that girl."

Her powerful words struck a chord

So Ruby found herself doing something she had never expected.

She told Mary that things were over with her boyfriend - giving her blessing to Mary to pursue a relationship with him.

But Mary’s response changed everything.

“She said, ‘no person who cannot control themselves and has no self-discipline can be in my circle, let alone be my boyfriend’," Ruby recalled.

"One thing that stayed with me after our coffee date was how much she loved herself.”

Mary encouraged Ruby to learn to love being single. Source: Pinterest

“She opened my eyes"

Ruby doesn't mean that in a negative way - it's just that she was completely blown away by how Mary didn't tolerate bullshit from men.

She learned that Mary has recently ended an eight-year-old relationship, but had no plans to make a move on Ruby's now-ex.

“I cannot tell you how much she inspired me to love my single life, because she was really enjoying it," Ruby said.

“She opened my eyes, she told me to enjoy sleeping alone in the bed and having the peace because one day I’ll find my real man, have kids and dream about those days.

"She knows what it feels like to be with a real man and will not settle for anything less because she absolutely has no problem being single.”

Mary was adamant that Ruby shouldn't forgive her ex. Source: Pinterest

"Then she looked me dead in the eye..."

But the moment that really changed Ruby's life for the better came just as they were about to leave.

Mary looked Ruby dead in the eye and told her that she believed giving a cheater a second chance makes you a weak person.

"Reconciliation is just you feeling sorry for yourself and thinking you don’t deserve or can’t get someone better. There’s nothing strong about the person who chose to be an option," Ruby remembered being told.

"Cheaters are weak, the ones who forgive them are weak too, I don’t want weak people around me, hence your rich, powerful lawyer ex-boyfriend will never get me.

"This girl is just too powerful to tolerate this kind of stuff, doesn’t mean you shouldn’t or should stay. Do as you know, it’s your life.

"Don’t give cheaters second chance, they don’t deserve us."

*Names have been changed
description: "She was an absolutely sweet person, gorgeous face and body. We only live two blocks apart."
